an1.188:1.1: “The foremost of my monk disciples in seniority is Koṇḍañña Who Understood.
an1.193:1.1: … from eminent families is Bhaddiya son of Kāḷīgodhā.
an1.194:1.1: … with a charming voice is Bhaddiya the Dwarf.
an1.195:1.1: … with a lion’s roar is Bhāradvāja the Alms-gatherer.
an1.196:1.1: … who speak on the teaching is Puṇṇa son of Mantāṇī.
an1.197:1.1: … who explain in detail the meaning of a brief statement is Mahākaccāna.”
